org.openimaj.image.processing.convolution

Class GaborFilters

    Utility methods for creating Gabor Filters
    Author:
    Jonathon Hare (jsh2@ecs.soton.ac.uk)

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods

      static FImage[] createGaborJets(int width, int height, int... orientationsPerScale)
      Create a jet of (multiscale) Gabor filters in the frequency domain.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • createGaborJets

        public static FImage[] createGaborJets(int width,
                                       int height,
                                       int... orientationsPerScale)
        Create a jet of (multiscale) Gabor filters in the frequency domain. The returned filters have the highest frequency in the centre; to apply them to an image, use FourierConvolve.convolvePrepared(FImage, FImage, boolean) with the third argument set to true.
        Parameters:
        width - the width of the image that will be filtered (note that the returned filters will have twice this width to account of the imaginary (phase) values [all of which are zero])
        height - the height of the image that will be filtered
        orientationsPerScale - the number of filter orientations for each scale (from HF to LF)
        Returns:
        the jet of filters
